results.title: Closed Mondays
results.brief_description: In a combination of graphics and three-dimensional clay figures, a little man discovers the world of art. He sees an open door and wanders through into an art exhibition. Paintings come alive and move around him as he watches. As he turns to go, he himself is put on a pedestal and bronzed. A 1975 Academy Award winner. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
results.description: In a combination of graphics and three-dimensional clay figures, a little man discovers the world of art. He sees an open door and wanders through into an art exhibition. results.title: Close encounters of the sexual kind (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. Designed to encourage a responsible attitude towards sex and contraception and the prevention of STD’s. The issues raised include AIDS, the need for medical check-ups, communication and condoms.

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description: A study of climbing plants, including such “scramblers” as the bramble and the rose; the leaf-holding clematis, the canary creeper, the root climbing ivy, etc.

results.title: Clickers club: photo adventures in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Tony Paice and Corporate Development, Western Region and TV ED Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the aims of a new photography club established throughout Victorian schools. Marg Sheehan interviews Leigh Hepburn who introduces the Project Kit, Roxanne Rodgers who explains its uses in an integrated curriculum and Gail Evans who applies the resources during a primary school class excursion to the zoo.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.

results.title: Clearing up the weather
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Rob Gell, well known weather forecaster and former lecturer in Geography, discusses the weather with Peter Couchman. He describes what causes particular weather patterns, looks at various types of storm activity, and discusses “El Nino” and the “Greenhouse Effect”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Clean up your act
results.brief_description: Encourages children to be aware of the danger inherent in slovenly habits in the kitchen, in care of their clothing, and in personal hygiene.

results.title: Clean and bright
results.brief_description: The need for cleanliness in both man and animals is illustrated using Mr Williams and his pet elephant, Maxwell. Mr Williams has provided all the necessities of life for Maxwell, except for a bath. Also shows animals and children cleaning themselves in various ways and provides a solution to Maxwell’s problem.

results.title: Claymation: three dimensional clay animation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Susan Shadburne, Pyramid Films and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles and processes of three dimensional clay animation. Shows the mixing of colour, creation of characters that move, production and editing of the live action film which serves as an animation guide, music scoring and the slow demanding process of working with the clay itself. Includes scenes from “Closed Monday” and “Martin the Cobbler”.
